intro: Ouratea flamignii, commonly known as the red-flowered ouratea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The plant's ornamental value is due to its striking floral display and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
